caseTitle: Abdul Wahab & others v. The State thr. P.G. Balochistan & another
authorJudge: Mr. Justice Asif Saeed Khan Khosa
tagline: According to the provisions of section 337-N(2), P.P.C. a punishment of imprisonment by way of Ta'zir can be passed against a convict only if the convict is "previous convict, habitual or hardened, desperate or dangerous criminal or the offence has been committed by him in the name or on the pretext of honour". Moreover in a case pertaining to causing of hurt unless the provisions of section 337-N(2), P.P.C. are attracted to the case of the convict he cannot be awarded a sentence of imprisonment by way of Ta'zir.
